I would not recommend the second result, even if it was successful in the end.
I have never smoked and have only had a minor dalliance with alcoholic drinks. They do not appeal to me.
In retrospect, it's probably limited my social interactions somewhat, but most respect my choices.
I have fun selling tobacco to people who want to stop smoking
Suffice to say, I'm a tad conflicted.
I remember growing up the intense smoke-filled haze of bowling alleys in my city. It was crazy how prevalent it was 30 years ago.
I think nowadays the only public places that allow smoking are casinos.
Part of it is is we know just how bad smoking is now.
Not even joking, like half of my regulars say they need to stop smoking
And a huge part of it is the cost.
